data.content: Crea un chatbot para hacer reservas de hoteles.

To create a chatbot for hotel reservations using Taskyto, we will need to define several modules, including a top-level menu, data gathering modules for user input (like check-in and check-out dates, number of guests, and room preferences), and action modules to process the reservation. Below is the complete YAML content for the chatbot.

### Top-Level Menu
```yaml
# -----> File: top_level.yaml <-----
modules:
- name: top-level
  kind: menu
  presentation: |
    Welcome to the Hotel Reservation Chatbot! I can help you book a room at our hotel. 
    Please let me know how I can assist you today.
  fallback: I'm sorry, I didn't understand that. Could you please rephrase?

  items:
  - title: Make a reservation
    memory: full
    kind: module
    reference: reservation_flow
  - title: Frequently Asked Questions
    kind: module
    reference: faq
  - title: Welcome Message
    kind: answer
    answer: |
      Hello! I'm here to assist you with your hotel reservations. What would you like to do?
```

### Reservation Flow
```yaml
# -----> File: reservation_flow.yaml <-----
modules:
- name: reservation_flow
  kind: menu
  presentation: |
    Let's start with your reservation. Please provide the necessary details.
  fallback: I'm sorry, I didn't understand that. Could you please rephrase?

  items:
  - title: Gather reservation details
    memory: full
    kind: sequence
    references:
      - gather_dates
      - gather_guests
      - gather_room_preferences
      - confirm_reservation
```

### Gather Dates
```yaml
# -----> File: gather_dates.yaml <-----
name: gather_dates
kind: data_gathering
description: |
  Please provide your check-in and check-out dates for the reservation.
data:
  - check_in_date: date
  - check_out_date: date

on-success:
  response:
    text: "You have selected check-in on {check_in_date} and check-out on {check_out_date}."
    rephrase: in-caller
```

### Gather Guests
```yaml
# -----> File: gather_guests.yaml <-----
name: gather_guests
kind: data_gathering
description: |
  How many guests will be staying in the room? Please provide the number of adults and children.
data:
  - adults: integer
  - children: integer

on-success:
  response:
    text: "You have indicated {adults} adult(s) and {children} child(ren) for the reservation."
    rephrase: in-caller
```

### Gather Room Preferences
```yaml
# -----> File: gather_room_preferences.yaml <-----
name: gather_room_preferences
kind: data_gathering
description: |
  What type of room would you like? Please select from the following options: Single, Double, Suite.
data:
  - room_type:
      type: enum
      values:
        - Single
        - Double
        - Suite

on-success:
  response:
    text: "You have chosen a {room_type} room."
    rephrase: in-caller
```

### Confirm Reservation
```yaml
# -----> File: confirm_reservation.yaml <-----
name: confirm_reservation
kind: action
data:
  - check_in_date: date
  - check_out_date: date
  - adults: integer
  - children: integer
  - room_type:
      type: enum
      values:
        - Single
        - Double
        - Suite

on-success:
  execute:
    language: python
    code: confirm_reservation.py
  response:
    text: "Your reservation has been confirmed! You will be staying in a {room_type} room from {check_in_date} to {check_out_date} for {adults} adult(s) and {children} child(ren)."
    rephrase: simple
```

### FAQ Module
```yaml
# -----> File: faq.yaml <-----
name: faq
kind: question_answering
description: Frequently asked questions about the hotel.
questions:
- question: What are the check-in and check-out times?
  answer: Check-in is at 3 PM and check-out is at 11 AM.
- question: Do you offer free breakfast?
  answer: Yes, we offer complimentary breakfast for all guests.
- question: Is there a cancellation policy?
  answer: Yes, you can cancel your reservation up to 24 hours before check-in without any charge.
```

### Python Script for Confirming Reservation
```python
# -----> File: confirm_reservation.py <-----
def main(check_in_date, check_out_date, adults, children, room_type):
    # Here you would typically process the reservation logic
    return f"Reservation confirmed for {adults} adult(s) and {children} child(ren) in a {room_type} room from {check_in_date} to {check_out_date}."

```

This YAML content and the accompanying Python script will help you create a functional hotel reservation chatbot using Taskyto. You can copy and paste each section into your Taskyto project files. Let me know if you need any further assistance!
